comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I have been trying to find out exactly where this lane was. I think it was on the east side of Sussex St, between Market and Druitt Streets. The 'SINGER' sign is a clue - I think it was on a warehouse in York or Clarence St, but I can't remember where I saw it! 1895 Map - www.nla.gov.au/apps/cdview?pi=nla.map-rm3443-sd&rgn=0...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Plague Album No.1, image 7 , Digital Order No. a147004 (State Library NSW) acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/albumView.aspx?acmsID=412968&...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Found it already - it was where I thought, and the lane is now called Druitt Place. Google street view is a good comparison shot - maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&source=s_q&hl=en&... And the Singer sign is visible on the left of the Town Hall here - acms.sl.nsw.gov.au/album/ItemViewer.aspx?itemid=823637&am...

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: Very nice detective work, yet again, beachcomberaustralia! It's always interesting to see the 'now and then' photos together. Thanks

comment.author: 29029178@N03
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Sydney's older buildings and structures. , and we'd love to have this added to the group!
